a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif;font-weight:500

text.tspan: Gender wage gap vs. GDP per capita, 2016
The unadjusted gender wage gap is the difference between average earnings of men and women, as a percentage of
average earnings of men. GDP per capita is adjusted to account for differences in price levels across countries. Colors
represent world regions. Bubble sizes are proportional to the population of the country.
Data source: ILOSTAT, Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank
